text: At Northwestern Mutual, we are strong, innovative and growing. We invest in our people. We care and make a positive difference.

text.2: To support our growing team, we are looking for an Associate Engineer to work with our ICS Reporting & Analytics team. You're the right fit if you love to solve problems and are always striving to learn new things. We're looking for self-motivated and self-driven engineers who are passionate about what they do and love technology. You will be working with our team to build, consolidate, simplify, and support dashboards and reporting tools delivering improved visual and analytical data which drive informed decisions. The team builds collectors and manages data providing visualization and dashboards throughout the company to show progress towards reaching the company's security and DevOps goals. The team is remote with an occasional opportunity to travel to our Milwaukee or New York campuses.

li: Bachelor's Degree in Computer Science or equivalent experience
li.1: Familiarity with Agile methodologies/DevOps, continuous integration, continuous deployment (CICD) beneficial
li.2: Fast learner and self-starter. The people you will work with are willing to share knowledge and lend a helping hand, but you must be willing to take initiative, work with minimal supervision, and actively interact with other team members
li.3: Bring new ideas and new ways of solving problems to the team
li.4: Ability to research, perform quantitative analysis
li.5: Building and maintaining dashboards and reports to quickly visualize actionable insights and effective decisions
li.6: Continuously improve dashboards and data by applying standards and responding to feedback
li.7: Proactively learn emerging platforms and related technology
li.8: Use of existing procedures to solve standard problems; analyze information and standard practices to make judgements

text: Work within standardized procedures & practices to achieve objectives and meet deadlines

li.1: Proficient in at least one programming language (Python, Go, Rust, Typescript, JavaScript, Java)
li.2: API development and web app development a plus
li.3: Database and SQL experience a plus
li.4: Source Control Management (Git), Public Cloud experience (AWS), containerization (Docker) experience all a plus
li.5: Dashboard / Reporting Tools (Grafana, PowerBI) a plus
li.6: Ability to articulate opinions to team members and share ideas, good verbal/written communications
li.7: Self-learner: willingly immerse yourself in technology to obtain new skills, insights and certification

text: Certification in Cloud Platform (AWS) or DevOps technology advantageous

li: Tuition reimbursement, commuter plans, and paid time off
li.1: Highly competitive compensation that include base salary plus bonus

text: Medical/Dental/Vision plans, 401(k), pension program, and more!

text.3: If any of this excites you, we want to hear from you!

text: Grow your career with a best-in-class company that puts our client=E2=80=99s interests at the center of all we do. Get started now!

action employer and all qualified applicants will receive consideration for employment without regard to race, color, religion, gender identity or expression, sexual orientation, national origin, disability, age or status as a protected veteran, or any other characteristic protected by law.

text.8: We=E2=80=99re excited about the potential people bring to Northwestern Mutual. You can grow your career here while enjoying first-class perks, benefits, and commitment to diversity and inclusion.
